channel.title: Best way to run VM for Fedora 37?
channel.description:
I'm wanting to run VM's on my fedora 37 workstation.
I'm using the "boxes" application for my VM's as of now.
Any better suggestions other than Vmware?
Is there any way to make VM's display 165hz?

item.title: Best way to run VM for Fedora 37?
item.dc:creator: system
item.description:
This topic was automatically closed 3 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

Read full topic
item.source: Best way to run VM for Fedora 37?

item.title: Best way to run VM for Fedora 37?
item.dc:creator: BillGatesSux
item.description:
I think that virtualbox has better GPU support, although I do not even know if fedora supports 165 hz.

Read full topic
item.source: Best way to run VM for Fedora 37?
